quiz1.question: In order for a protestor to receive an automatic stop-work order, the timeline for vendor to submit a post-award protest to GAO is:-
options: 1294. 5 calendar days after receipt of a debriefing.
8768. 10 calendar days after contract award or within 5 days after a debriefing date, whichever is later.

quiz2.question: Disappointed vendors have 10 days after receipt of a Debriefing to submit a protest to the US Court of Federal Claims (COFC).
quiz2.correctExplaination: False. There is no time limit for filing a protest at COFC.

quiz3.question: Vendors receive an automatic stop-work order if they file a protest at GAO within 10 days after receipt of a debriefing.
quiz3.correctExplaination: False. In order to gain the automatic stop-work order, the protest has to be filed within 5 days after receipt of the debriefing.

quiz4.question: question:After the Contracting Officer provided a debriefing to the disappointed vendor and process is completed. 5 days later, the vendor has submitted additional questions.  Should you provide responses?
quiz4.followupQuestion: If the Contracting officer does submit responses to the newly submitted questions,  this triggers a new __ day clock to submit a protest.
